metadata.titel_preek: Trinity Sunday & Second Sunday After Pentecost

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Triune God pursues and redeems a self-destructing humanity through unconditional, self-giving love.

subject.identificatie: The Triune God (Father, Son, Holy Spirit)
tekstueel_bewijs: God pursues us even beyond the grave
The Someone who is eternal... pursues us
He shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities

object.identificatie: Redemption and Restoration of the 'Miserable Offender'

zender.identificatie: The Nature of the Trinity (Self-giving Love)
tekstueel_bewijs: The inmost being of God is a dynamic interrelatedness that pours itself out

ontvanger.identificatie: The 'Miserable Offender' / The Church in Corinth / The Hearer
tekstueel_bewijs: the church that was breaking his heart gets the full blessing

helper.identificatie: Jesus Christ (Incarnation/Blood) and the Holy Spirit
tekstueel_bewijs: God’s love spends itself to the very last drop of the blood of the Son
the love that has become incarnate in history through Jesus Christ
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who provides the Helper (Himself)

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin as a 'Vast Primordial Catastrophe' and Self-Destruction
tekstueel_bewijs: depths of human pride, disobedience, perversity, and self-will
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described not as a mistake but as a catastrophic ontological state ('no health in us') that requires divine intervention.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Human response of confession and worship as a result of being saved.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer / The Psalmist
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Honesty, confession, and 'fear of the Lord'
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The human action (confession) is explicitly framed as a result of God's prior movement ('Not the man who is lost, but the man who is about to be saved can understand that he is a sinner').

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: The Son/Spirit → The Triune God ← Sin/Death

voorbeelden_god_subject: God pursues us even beyond the grave.

voorbeelden: things which we ought to have done
if he could somehow rebuild trust
knowledge that he and everyone else is a miserable offender
total inability to present ourselves righteous

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on human 'non-pouvoir' (inability) met by God's 'pouvoir' (sovereign power to save).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (The Depths) through ~S1 (Acknowledgment of no health) to S1 (Plenteous redemption).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the 'Fear of the Lord' which is a response to S1, not a condition for it.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; S2 is described as a primordial catastrophe.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the active Subject and humanity as the passive, desperate recipient of a love that is 'not dependent on the worthiness of the other.'

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Potential Exemplarism in the parent analogy
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: You are like most parents—you would do anything

indicatoren_genade.indicator: Unconditional nature of the Subject's action
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: It is not dependent on the worthiness of the other
total inability to present ourselves righteous before the Lord

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Human parents/mentors are used as 'glimmers' or 'hints' of God, but the sermon explicitly states they are only small measures of the perfect love of God.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: Paul's desperation is a reflection of God's agony over the lost.

identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; God is the sole author of the rescue.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'depths' of the law to the 'heights' of Trinitarian grace is perfectly integrated.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'fear' and 'forgiveness' is resolved theocentrically.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: God’s love spends itself to the very last drop of the blood of the Son.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the 'fellowship' and the 'pouring forth' of divine love into the receiver.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is 'estrangement' and 'primordial catastrophe' rather than just mistakes.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a textbook example of a grace-oriented narrative structure where God is the Subject of all transformative verbs.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is appropriate for a sermon on Grace.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (Program 1) clearly precedes and enables Ethics/Confession (Program 2).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon masterfully avoids the trap of moralism by grounding human confession in the prior, objective reality of God's Trinitarian love.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis might focus on the 'parent' metaphor's emotional impact, Greimas shows that the metaphor functions to establish God as the Subject of a rescue mission.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the 'miserable offender' phrase historically; semiotics shows how that phrase functions to strip the human Subject of 'Pouvoir-faire'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that the 'Fear of the Lord' in this sermon is not a 'Devoir' (obligation) but a 'Savoir' (knowledge) resulting from the Object (Forgiveness) being granted.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses Fleming Rutledge's own principles effectively.
